trans-unit.source: Represents the fundamental building block of workflows.
<xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> is the base class for all activities.
An <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> is the fundamental building block of workflows.
An <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> defines a set of properties and events, such as any class, along with execution logic that defines the activity's run-time behavior.
A set of additional components can be associated with an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.
These include, but are not limited to a validator, a code generator, custom serializers, and a designer.
All activities share a common set of properties defined on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> base class.
Each <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> can declare its own additional properties according to its requirements by extending this class.

Because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> derives from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject>, properties can be defined as standard CLR properties and as dependency properties.
The execution logic of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> fulfills a contract that exists between any <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> and the workflow runtime.

You must document the execution logic of any <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> in a functional sense, so that a workflow developer who uses the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> knows how it behaves.

The execution logic itself is hidden from the workflow developer who includes the activity in a workflow, because the execution logic is part of a contract that exists strictly between the workflow runtime and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> class, while initializing the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Name"></xref>.
The name to associate with this instance.
The name must conform to the variable naming conventions for the programming language that is being used in the Workflow project, and must be unique in the workflow.
name is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Called by the workflow runtime to cancel execution of an activity that is currently executing.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> that contains the instance to cancel.
The status at the end of the operation that determines whether the activity remains in the canceling state or transitions to the closed state.
Occurs when the activity execution is canceled.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Cancel%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Canceling"></xref> event.
You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property.
This dependency property is the public static field named `XProperty` or `XEvent`, where X is the corresponding property.
Creates a deep copy of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Uses a <xref:System.IO.MemoryStream> to copy the activity and creates a new activity by deserializing from that particular <xref:System.IO.MemoryStream>.
A deep copy of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Occurs when an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> has completed execution.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Closed> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Closed"></xref> event.
You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property.
This dependency property is the public static field named `XProperty` or `XEvent`, where X is the corresponding property.
Occurs when running a compensation method on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Compensating> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Compensating"></xref> event.
You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property.
This dependency property is the public static field named `XProperty` or `XEvent`, where X is the corresponding property.
Gets or sets the user-defined description of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
This property is a meta property, which means it cannot be changed at runtime.
Meta properties do not change after a property instance is created at runtime, so the property must be set to a literal value at design time.
The text description of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this instance is enabled for execution and validation.
If `false`, all child activities are treated as if this value is `false` for them also.
This property is a meta property, which means it cannot be changed at runtime.
Meta properties do not change after a property instance is created at runtime, so the property must be set to a literal value at design time.
`true` if enabled for execution and validation; `false` otherwise.
Called by the workflow runtime to execute an activity.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext> is used to get information about the currently running activity and workflow, and is also used to obtain services from the runtime environment.
The running occurs synchronously, returning control to the caller when the activity is completed or reaches an intermediate state.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> to associate with this <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> and execution.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus"></xref> of the run task, which determines whether the activity remains in the executing state, or transitions to the closed state.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> is run.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Executing> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Executing"></xref> event, which occurs when the activity is executed.
You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property.
This dependency property is the public static field named `XProperty` or `XEvent`, where X is the corresponding property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionResult"></xref> of the last attempt to run this instance.
This property is only useful when a workflow instance is running.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionResult"></xref> of the last attempt to run this instance.
Gets the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus"></xref> of this instance.
This property is only useful when a workflow instance is running.
The current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus"></xref> of this instance.
Occurs when an exception is raised during the running of the instance.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Faulting"></xref> event.
You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property.
This dependency property is the public static field named `XProperty` or `XEvent`, where X is the corresponding property.

Returns the instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> whose name is requested from the set of all activities running under the root activity of this instance, which is within the workflow.
Calling `GetActivityByName` from within the constructor of a custom activity is not supported and can have unexpected results.
The name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to search for.
The instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> whose name is requested from the set of all activities running under the root activity of this instance.
activityQualifiedID is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

Returns the instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> whose name is requested from the set of all activities under the root the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> of this instance if the second parameter is `false` and under the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> if the second parameter is `true`.

Returns the instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> whose name is requested from the set of all activities under the root the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> of this instance if the second parameter is `false` and under the current <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> if the second parameter is `true`.
Calling `GetActivityByName` from within the constructor of a custom activity is not supported and can have unexpected results.
The name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to search for.
The value that indicates whether to limit the search to activities contained within this instance.

The instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> whose name is requested from the set of all activities under the root the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> of this instance if the second parameter is `false` and under the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> if the second parameter is `true`.
activityQualifiedID is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Called when an exception is raised within the context of the execution of this instance.
The default method tries to call the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Cancel%2A> method and returns the result of this attempt.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> for this instance.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that caused this fault.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus"></xref> that results from an attempt to cancel this instance.
exception is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Called by the workflow runtime to initialize an activity during the construction of a new workflow instance.
This method is called during the construction of a dynamic <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> that provides the initialization service.
provider is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Subscribes an <xref href="System.EventHandler"></xref> and invokes that delegate.
The <xref href="System.EventHandler"></xref> to be invoked.
The <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> to associate with this event
The specified type.
Subscribes an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> and invokes that delegate.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.IActivityEventListener`1"></xref> to be invoked.
The <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> to associate with this event
The specified type.
Gets information about whether the activity is executing within the default <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> of the workflow instance.
Returns `false` if the activity is executing within the default <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> of the workflow instance, otherwise returns `true`.
Loads an instance of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> from a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
Calling this method with untrusted data is a security risk.
Call this method only with trusted data.
For more information, see [Untrusted Data Security Risks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330378).
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> from which to load.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> that owns the context for the deserialized <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
An instance of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> from a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
stream is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

Loads an instance of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> from a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> using the custom <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter"></xref> for deserialization.
Calling this method with untrusted data is a security risk.
Call this method only with trusted data.
For more information, see [Untrusted Data Security Risks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330378).
The target <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> of the load operation.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> that owns the context for the deserialized <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter"></xref> used to read from the <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
An instance of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> from a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
formatter is a null reference (`Nothing`).
Gets or sets the name of this instance.
This name must conform to the variable naming convention of the programming language that is being used in the Workflow project.
Default value for this is the empty string.
This property is a meta property, which means it cannot be changed at runtime.
Meta properties do not change after a property instance is created at runtime, so the property must be set to a literal value at design time.
The name of this instance.
Called by the workflow runtime whenever an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> is loaded.

For example, this method is called during the creation of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> as well as every time the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> is reincarnated when a workflow instance is loaded from persistent storage.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> that provides the service.
Called by the workflow runtime whenever an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> is unloaded.

For example, this method is called during completion of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> as well as every time the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext"></xref> is unloaded when a workflow instance is persisted.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> that provides the service.
Called by the workflow runtime as part of the activity's transition to the closed state.
This method provides the activity with an opportunity to clean up resources utilized during its execution.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> that provides the service.
Gets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity"></xref> that contains this <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Returnsa null reference(`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> is a workflow or a root <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> that is a parent to this <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Gets the qualified name of the activity.
Qualified activity names are always unique in a workflow instance.
The qualified name is the name of this instance with the name of the custom activity that contains this instance appended to the front.
The qualified name of the instance.
Raises an <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberTypes.Event"></xref> associated with the specified dependency property.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberTypes.Event"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> source of the <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberTypes.Event"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberTypes.Event"></xref>.
Raises the event associated with the referenced <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberTypes.Event"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> source of the event.
The <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberTypes.Event"></xref>.
The specified type.
Registers the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> for the status change event.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to register.
The object that implements the Event Listener interface for this registration.
dependencyProp is not one of the following:
Writes the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> for persistence.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to which to save the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
stream is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

Writes the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> to a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> for persistence using the custom <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter"></xref> provided for serialization.
Soap formatters are not supported by Windows Workflow Foundation.
The target <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> of the save operation.
The binary or custom <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter"></xref> for the serialization.
formatter is a null reference (`Nothing`).
This instance is in design mode.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatus"></xref> of a running <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> changes.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.StatusChanged> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

When an activity (Activity A) subscribes to a different activity's (Activity B) `StatusChanged` event, the `Activity` property of the associated <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionStatusChangedEventArgs> refers to the activity subscribed to (Activity B), and the associated `Sender` object refers to the execution context of the subscribing activity (Activity A).
Represents the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> that targets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.StatusChanged"></xref> event.
You indirectly access each public property and event of this type by the resolution of a corresponding dependency property.
This dependency property is the public static field named `XProperty` or `XEvent`, where X is the corresponding property.
Provides a string that represents this instance.
The string returned is a combination of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.QualifiedName%2A> and the <xref:System.Type.FullName%2A> of the type of this instance.
This instance.
Informs the run-time tracking infrastructure of pending tracking information.
<xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the tracking information.
userData is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Informs the run-time tracking infrastructure of pending tracking information.
The key to the user data that has changed.
<xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the tracking information.
userData is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
When overridden in a derived class, provides un-initialization by a service provider for the activity.
This method provides the activity with an opportunity to clean up resources allocated during initialization.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.Uninitialize%2A> is called when an activity instance is guaranteed not to perform any more execution.

For activities that do not implement <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ICompensatableActivity>, this occurs immediately after the activity closes, or, if the activity never executed, at workflow completion.
For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ICompensatableActivity> activities, this occurs either after compensation or at workflow completion.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> that provides the service.
Un-registers the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> for the status change event.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to un-register.
The object that implements the Event Listener interface for this registration.
dependencyProp is not one of the following:
Gets the <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the instance.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the instance.
